snippet: A U.S. appeals court on Thursday said the National Football League was within its rights to suspend Minnesota Vikings running back Adrian Peterson in a child assault case, handing the league a new legal victory in disciplining its star players....
lead_paragraph: A U.S. appeals court on Thursday said the National Football League was within its rights to suspend Minnesota Vikings running back Adrian Peterson in a child assault case, handing the league a new legal victory in disciplining its star players.

headline.main: NFL Had Authority to Suspend Vikings' Peterson-Appeals Court
headline.print_headline: NFL Had Authority to Suspend Vikings' Peterson-Appeals Court
